channel.title: How do i permanetly set the PATH?
channel.description: hello i am learning java and am working on my server, however i cannot figure out how to permanetly set the PATH to the jdk bin. i am tired of having to manualley compile it so if someone knows how to permanetly set the PATH please tell me.

item.title: How do i permanetly set the PATH?
item.dc:creator: @chauncey chauncey
item.description:
@chauncey wrote:

yo dude i cant even get the path set…i tryed downloading and i followed these instructions

first of all you have to have java JDK 5.0
you can get it from here

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/download.jsp

After you download it, to install it (so you can compile and shit) go to:

Start > controls panel > system > advanced > enviroment variables

after that doulbe click on “PATH” and in the box that comes up put the path to java JDK

to get the path go to start > search and then search for “Javac”

usually its the first thing that comes up anways right click on what comes up from the search and select “Properties”

It will say something like location. The location IS YOUR PATH! just put the location as your path and your done… Anything goes wrong post it…

Read full topic
item.source: How do i permanetly set the PATH?
